Source code for flow.events

from rakizo.event_essentials.events import Event
from rakizo.logging_config.logging_config import setup_logger
from rakizo.test_utils.decorators import event

logger = setup_logger()



[docs]class BaseFlowEvent(Event):  # pylint: disable=C0302
    """
    BaseFlowEvent Event class
    """

    def __init__(self, builder):
        """
        Initialization method for BaseFlowEvent
        Takes builder object and sets properties

        :param builder: Builder object
        """
        super().__init__(builder)
        self.name = getattr(builder, '_name', None)
        self.flowVersion = getattr(builder, '_flow_version', None)
        self.description = getattr(builder, '_description', None)
        self.createdBy = getattr(builder, '_created_by', None)
        self.updatedBy = getattr(builder, '_updated_by', None)
        self.widgetId = getattr(builder, '_widget_id', None)
        self.widgetType = getattr(builder, '_widget_type', None)
        self.widgetName = getattr(builder, '_widget_name', None)
        self.stepConnection = getattr(builder, '_step_connection', None)


[docs]    def get_metrics(self):  # pragma: no cover
        """
        Returns metrics
        :return: List[Metric]
        """
        return []



[docs]    class Builder(Event.Builder):  # pylint: disable=W0223
        """
        Builder class for BaseFlowEvent
        """

        def __init__(self, aggregate_id, trigger, entity_id=None, entity_type=None):
            """
            Initialization method for Builder class
            Takes aggregate_id, trigger, entity_id and entity_type and sets accordingly

            :param aggregate_id: str object
            :param trigger: str object
            :param entity_id: str object
            :param entity_type: str object
            """
            super().__init__(aggregate_id, trigger, entity_id, entity_type)
            self.sessionId = None
            self.companyId = None


[docs]        def name(self, flow_name):
            """
            Takes flow_name and sets property in builder

            :param flow_name: string object
            :return: Builder objects
            """
            self._name = flow_name
            return self



[docs]        def flow_version(self, flow_version):
            """
            Takes flow_version and sets property in builder

            :param flow_version: string object
            :return: Builder objects
            """
            self._flow_version = flow_version
            return self



[docs]        def description(self, flow_description):
            """
            Takes flow_description and sets property in builder

            :param flow_description: string object
            :return: Builder objects
            """
            self._description = flow_description
            return self



[docs]        def widget_id(self, widget_id):
            """
            Takes widget_id and sets property in builder

            :param widget_id: string object
            :return: Builder object
            """
            self._widget_id = widget_id
            return self



[docs]        def widget_type(self, widget_type):
            """
            Takes widget_type and sets property in builder

            :param widget_type: string object
            :return: Builder objects
            """
            self._widget_type = widget_type
            return self



[docs]        def widget_name(self, widget_name):
            """
            Takes widget_name and sets property in builder

            :param widget_name: string object
            :return: Builder objects
            """
            self._widget_name = widget_name
            return self



[docs]        def step_connection(self, step_connection):
            """
            Takes step connection and sets property in builder

            :param step_connection: list object
            :return: Builder object
            """
            self._step_connection = step_connection
            return self



[docs]        def created_by(self, flow_created_by):
            """
            Takes flow_created_by and sets property in builder

            :param flow_created_by: string object
            :return: Builder objects
            """
            self._created_by = flow_created_by
            return self



[docs]        def updated_by(self, user_id):
            """
            Takes user_id and sets property in builder

            :param user_id: string object
            :return: Builder objects
            """
            self._updated_by = user_id
            return self




[docs]@event
class FlowCreated(BaseFlowEvent):
    """
    FlowCreated Event class
    """


[docs]    def get_name(self):
        """
        Returns name of the flow

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.name



[docs]    def get_flow_version(self):
        """
        Returns version of the flow

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.flowVersion



[docs]    def get_description(self):
        """
        Returns description of the flow

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.description



[docs]    def get_created_by(self):
        """
        Returns created by of the flow

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.createdBy



[docs]    def get_metrics(self):
        """
        Returns metric lists for the event

        :return: List[Metric]
        """
        return []



[docs]    class Builder(BaseFlowEvent.Builder):
        """
        Builder class for FlowCreated Event
        """

        def __init__(self, aggregate_id, entity_id=None, entity_type=None):
            """
            Initialization method for FlowCreated event
            Takes aggregate_id, entity_id and entity_type to build event

            :param aggregate_id: str object
            :param entity_id: str object
            :param entity_type: str object
            """
            trigger = 'create'
            super().__init__(aggregate_id, trigger, entity_id, entity_type)


[docs]        def build(self):
            """
            Returns FlowCreated object built by the builder
            :return: FlowCreated object
            """
            return FlowCreated(self)




[docs]class BaseFlowFieldUpdate(BaseFlowEvent):
    """
    BaseFlowFieldUpdate Event class
    """


[docs]    class Builder(BaseFlowEvent.Builder):  # pylint: disable=W0223
        """
        Builder class for BaseFlowFieldUpdate Event
        """

        def __init__(self, aggregate_id, entity_id=None, entity_type=None):
            """
            Initialization method for BaseFlowFieldUpdate Event's Builder class

            :param aggregate_id: str object
            :param entity_id: str object
            :param entity_type: str object
            """
            trigger = 'update'
            super().__init__(aggregate_id, trigger, entity_id, entity_type)


[docs]        def old_value(self, value):
            """
            Takes value and set is as oldValue and returns Builder object

            :param value: str or dict object
            :return: Builder object
            """
            self._old_value = value
            return self



[docs]        def new_value(self, value):
            """
            Takes value and set it as newValue and returns Builder object

            :param value: str or dict object
            :return: Builder object
            """
            self._new_value = value
            return self




[docs]@event
class FlowNameUpdated(BaseFlowFieldUpdate):
    """
    FlowNameUpdated Event Class
    """

    def __init__(self, builder):
        """
        Initialization method for FlowNameUpdated Event
        Takes builder object and sets properties

        :param builder: Builder object
        """
        super().__init__(builder)

        self.oldName = getattr(builder, '_old_value', None)
        self.newName = getattr(builder, '_new_value', None)


[docs]    def get_old_name(self):
        """
        Returns old value of the flow name

        :return: dict object
        """
        return self.oldName



[docs]    def get_new_name(self):
        """
        Returns new value of the flow name

        :return: dict object
        """
        return self.newName



[docs]    def get_change(self):
        """
        Returns new value and old value of the flow name

        :return: dict object
        """
        return {'name': {
            'old_value': self.get_old_name(),
            'new_value': self.get_new_name()
        }}



[docs]    def get_flow_version(self):
        """
        Returns version of the flow

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.flowVersion



[docs]    def get_description(self):
        """
        Returns description of the flow

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.description



[docs]    def get_updated_by(self):
        """
        Returns updated by of the flow

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.updatedBy



[docs]    def get_metrics(self):
        """
        Returns metric lists for the event

        :return: List[Metric]
        """
        return []



[docs]    class Builder(BaseFlowFieldUpdate.Builder):
        """
        Builder class for FlowNameUpdated Event
        """


[docs]        def build(self):
            """
            Returns FlowNameUpdated object built by the builder
            :return: FlowNameUpdated object
            """
            return FlowNameUpdated(self)

[docs]class BaseFlowUpdated(BaseFlowEvent):
    """
    BaseFlowUpdated Event class

[docs]    class Builder(BaseFlowEvent.Builder):  # pylint: disable=W0223
        """
        Builder class for BaseFlowUpdated Event
        """

        def __init__(self, aggregate_id, entity_id=None, entity_type=None):
            """
            Initialization method for BaseFlowUpdated Event's Builder class

            :param aggregate_id: str object
            :param entity_id: str object
            :param entity_type: str object
            """
            trigger = 'update'
            super().__init__(aggregate_id, trigger, entity_id, entity_type)


[docs]        def change_info(self, values: dict):
            """
            Takes updated info and returns Builder object

            :param values: dict object
            :return: Builder object
            """
            self._change_info = values
            return self

        Takes builder object and sets properties

        """
        super().__init__(builder)
        self.changeInfo = getattr(builder, '_change_info', None)

[docs]@event
class StepPositionUpdated(BaseFlowFieldUpdate):
    """
    StepPositionUpdated Event Class
    """

    def __init__(self, builder):
        """
        Initialization method for StepPositionUpdated Event
        Takes builder object and sets properties

        :param builder: Builder object
        """
        super().__init__(builder)

        self.oldPosition = getattr(builder, '_old_value', None)
        self.newPosition = getattr(builder, '_new_value', None)


[docs]    def get_old_position(self):
        """
        Returns old value of the step position

        :return: dict object
        """
        return self.oldPosition



[docs]    def get_new_position(self):
        """
        Returns new value of the step position

        :return: dict object
        """
        return self.newPosition



[docs]    def get_change(self):
        """
        Returns new value and old value of
        the flow step position

        :return: dict object
        """
        return {'position': {
            'old_value': self.get_old_position(),
            'new_value': self.get_new_position()
        }}



[docs]    def get_widget_id(self):
        """
        Returns widget id of the flow step

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.widgetId



[docs]    def get_widget_type(self):
        """
        Returns widget type of the flow step

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.widgetType



[docs]    def get_updated_by(self):
        """
        Returns updated by of the flow step

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.updatedBy



[docs]    def get_metrics(self):
        """
        Returns metric lists for the event

        :return: List[Metric]
        """
        return []



[docs]    class Builder(BaseFlowFieldUpdate.Builder):
        """
        Builder class for StepPositionUpdated Event
        """


[docs]        def build(self):
            """
            Returns StepPositionUpdated object built by the builder
            :return: StepPositionUpdated object
            """
            return StepPositionUpdated(self)

        self.oldSize = getattr(builder, '_old_value', None)
        self.newSize = getattr(builder, '_new_value', None)

        return self.oldSize

        """

        :return: dict object
        """
        return self.newSize



[docs]    def get_change(self):
        """
        Returns new value and old value
        of the flow step size

        :return: dict object

        return {'size': {

            'new_value': self.get_new_size()

[docs]    class Builder(BaseFlowEvent.Builder):
        """
        Builder class for StepConnectionRemoved Event
        """

        def __init__(self, aggregate_id, entity_id=None, entity_type=None):
            """
            Initialization method for StepConnectionRemoved event
            Takes aggregate_id, entity_id and entity_type to build event

            :param aggregate_id: str object
            :param entity_id: str object
            :param entity_type: str object
            """
            trigger = 'delete'
            super().__init__(aggregate_id, trigger, entity_id, entity_type)


[docs]        def build(self):
            """
            Returns StepConnectionRemoved object built by the builder
            :return: StepConnectionRemoved object
            """
            return StepConnectionRemoved(self)

class FlowRestored(BaseFlowEvent):
    """
    FlowRestored Event class
    """


[docs]    def get_name(self):
        """
        Returns name of the flow

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.name



[docs]    def get_flow_version(self):
        """
        Returns version of the flow

        :return: str object
        """
        return self.flowVersion



[docs]    def get_metrics(self):
        """
        Returns metric lists for the event

        :return: List[Metric]
        """
        return []



[docs]    class Builder(BaseFlowEvent.Builder):
        """
        Builder class for FlowRestored Event
        """

        def __init__(self, aggregate_id, entity_id=None, entity_type=None):
            """
            Initialization method for FlowRestored event
            Takes aggregate_id, entity_id and entity_type to build event

            :param aggregate_id: str object
            :param entity_id: str object
            :param entity_type: str object
            """
            trigger = 'update'
            super().__init__(aggregate_id, trigger, entity_id, entity_type)


[docs]        def build(self):
            """
            Returns FlowRestored object built by the builder
            :return: FlowRestored object
            """
            return FlowRestored(self)
